Maud’s data model¶

Definitions of Maud-specific objects.

class maud.data_model.Compartment(id: str, name: str = None, volume: float = 1.0)¶

Constructor for compartment objects.

Parameters

  • id – compartment id, use a BiGG id if possible.

  • name – compartment name.

  • volume – compartment volume.

class maud.data_model.Enzyme(id: str, reaction_id: str, name: str, modifiers: Dict[str, List[maud.data_model.Modifier]] = None, subunits: int = 1)¶

Constructor for the enzyme object.

Parameters

  • id – a string identifying the enzyme

  • reaction_id – the id of the reaction the enzyme catalyses

  • name – human-understandable name for the enzyme

  • modifiers – modifiers, given as {‘modifier_id’: modifier_object}

  • subunits – number of subunits in enzymes

class maud.data_model.Experiment(id: str, measurements: Dict[str, Dict[str, maud.data_model.Measurement]] = None, metadata: str = None, knockouts: List[str] = None)¶

Constructor for condition object.

Parameters

  • id – condition id

  • unbalanced_met_info –

  • measurements – dictionary mapping keys ‘enzyme’, ‘metabolite’ and ‘reaction’

to dictionaries with the form {target id: measurement} :param metadata: any info about the condition

class maud.data_model.KineticModel(model_id: str, metabolites: Dict[str, maud.data_model.Metabolite], reactions: Dict[str, maud.data_model.Reaction], compartments: Dict[str, maud.data_model.Compartment], mics: Dict[str, maud.data_model.MetaboliteInCompartment])¶

Constructor for representation of a system of metabolic reactions.

Parameters

  • model_id – id of the kinetic model

  • metabolites – dictionary mapping strings to metabolite objects

  • reactions – dictionary mapping strings to reaction objects

  • compartments – dictionary mapping strings to compartment objects

  • mic – dictionary mapping strings to MetaboliteInCompartment objects

class maud.data_model.MaudInput(kinetic_model: maud.data_model.KineticModel, priors: Dict[str, List[maud.data_model.Prior]], stan_codes: Dict[str, Dict[str, int]], experiments: Dict[str, maud.data_model.Experiment] = None)¶

Everything that is needed to run Maud.

Parameters

  • kinetic_system – a KineticSystem object

  • priors – a dictionary mapping prior types to lists of Prior objects

  • codes (stan) – a dictionary with keys ‘metabolite’, ‘reaction’, ‘mic’,

‘experiment’, ‘balanced_mic’, ‘unbalanced_mic’ and ‘kinetic_parameter’, whose values are dictionaries mapping ids of the relevant objects to integer codes :param experiments: a dictionary mapping experiment ids to Experiment objects

class maud.data_model.Measurement(target_id: str, value: float, uncertainty: float = None, scale: str = None, target_type: str = None)¶

Constructor for measurement object.

Parameters

  • target_id – id of the thing being measured

  • value – value for the measurement

  • uncertainty – uncertainty associated to the measurent

  • scale – scale of the measurement, e.g. ‘log10’ or ‘linear

  • target_type – type of thing being measured, e.g. ‘metabolite’, ‘reaction’,

‘enzyme’.

class maud.data_model.Metabolite(id: str, name: str = None)¶

Constructor for metabolite objects.

Parameters

  • id – metabolite id, use a BiGG id if possible.

  • name – metabolite name.

class maud.data_model.MetaboliteInCompartment(id: str, metabolite_id: str = None, compartment_id: str = None, balanced: bool = None)¶

A metabolite, in a compartment, or mic for short.

Parameters

  • id – this mic’s id, usually <metabolite_id>_<compartment_id>.

  • metabolite_id – id of this mic’s metabolite

  • compartment_id – id of this mic’s compartment

  • balanced – Does this mic have stable concentration at steady state?

class maud.data_model.Modifier(mic_id: str, enzyme_id: str, modifier_type: str = None)¶

Constructor for modifier objects.

Parameters

  • mic_id – the id of the modifying metabolite-in-compartment

  • enzyme_id – the id of the modified enzyme

  • modifier_type – what is the modifier type, e.g.

‘allosteric_activator’, ‘allosteric_inhibitor’, ‘competitive inhibitor’

class maud.data_model.Parameter(id: str, enzyme_id: str, metabolite_id: str = None, is_thermodynamic: bool = False)¶

Constructor for parameter object.

Parameters

  • id – parameter id

  • enzyme_id – id of the enzyme associated with the parameter

  • metabolite_id – id of the metabolite associated with the parameter if any

class maud.data_model.Prior(id: str, location: float, scale: float, experiment_id: str = None, mic_id: str = None, metabolite_id: str = None, enzyme_id: str = None)¶

A prior distribuition.

As currently implemented, the target must be a single parameter and the distribution must have a location and a scale.

Parameters

  • id – a string identifying the prior object

  • target_id – a string identifying the thing that has a prior distribution

  • location – a number specifying the location of the distribution

  • scale – a number specifying the scale of the distribution

  • experiment_id – id of the relevant experiment (for enzymes or unbalanced

metabolites)

class maud.data_model.Reaction(id: str, name: str = None, reversible: bool = True, is_exchange: bool = None, stoichiometry: Dict[str, float] = None, enzymes: Dict[str, maud.data_model.Enzyme] = None, water_stoichiometry: float = 0)¶

Constructor for the reaction object.

Parameters

  • id – reaction id, use a BiGG id if possible.

  • name – reaction name.

  • reversible – whether or not reaction is reversible.

  • is_exchange – whether or not reaction is an exchange reaction.

  • stoichiometry – reaction stoichiometry,

e.g. for the reaction: 1.5 f6p <-> fdp we have {‘f6p’; -1.5, ‘fdp’: 1} :param enzymes: Dictionary mapping enzyme ids to Enzyme objects :param water_stroichiometry: Reaction’s stoichiometric coefficient for water
